intro: Leptasea tricuspidata, commonly known as the three-lobed fern, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its delicate, trifoliate leaves that are trifid at the base. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental species in tropical and subtropical regions.
